reference.title: Java error messages
reference.shortdesc: In addition to error messages generated by the DITA Open Toolkit, you might also encounter error messages generated by Java.

section.title: Out of Memory error
section.p: You receive a message that states that the build has failed due to an Out of Memory error.

Try the following approaches to resolve the problem:
(For custom-configured environments, not the DITA OT easy install) If you use Xalan as the default XSLT processor, switch to Saxon.
Increase the Java Virtual Memory (JVM).
Reduce memory consumption by setting the generate-debug-attributes option to "false". This option is set in the lib/configuration.properties file

section.title: java.io.IOException: Can't store Document
section.p: After running a JavaHelp transformation, you receive a java.io.IOException: Can't store Documentmessage.
This problem occurs when HTML files unrelated to the current transformation are found in the output directory. Delete the content of the output directory and run the transformation again.

section.title: Stack Overflow error
section.p: If you receive an error about a stack memory overflow, increase the JVM and run the transformation again.
